cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 105 miles SSE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving slowly north-northwest, forecast to turn north and track inland along the Carolina coast, then across southeastern Virginia toward the Chesapeake Bay/Maryland region late Monday before moving offshore to the north-east.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South/North Carolina border between Myrtle Beach and Cape Fear

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina, North Carolina, southeast Virginia and the Mid-Atlantic coast including Maryland
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible Monday, only a small (≤6%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in the Baltimore Harbor; surge of 1–2 ft confined to the Carolinas.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain may bring 1–2 inches to the Baltimore area late Monday into early Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated waves and rip-current risk along the Chesapeake Bay and Atlantic beaches could affect vessel traffic and pilot operations.
